text: The following are the ranks and insignia of the Belgian Armed Forces. Belgian official journal .http://www.staatsbladclip.be/lois/2007/04/10/loi-2007007077.html Depending on the uniform being worn (there are three: ceremonial, working, and operational)By Royal decree on (Belgian official journal du ). \- rank badges are worn in various places: in the middle of the chest, on the shoulders, at the wrists, etc. The ranks are given in English, Dutch, French, and German (the three official languages of Belgium). ==Officers== The rank insignia for commissioned officers for the army, navy, air force and Medical component respectively. {|style="border:1px solid #8888aa; NATO code ! colspan=2 | Army component ! colspan=2 | Air component ! colspan=2 | Navy component ! colspan=2 | Medical component |- ! colspan=9 | Senior non- commissioned officers - Hoofdonderofficieren - Sous-officiers supérieurs - Hochrangigeunteroffiziere |- | OR-9 | Chief warrant officer | 50px | Chief warrant officer | 50px | Chief principal master | 50px | Chief warrant officer | 50px |- | OR-9 | Master warrant officer | 50px | Master warrant officer | 50px | Principal master | 50px | Master warrant officer | 50px |- ! colspan=9 | Elite non-commissioned officers - Keuronderofficieren - Sous-officiers d'élite - Eliteunteroffiziere |- | OR-8 | Warrant officer | 50px | Warrant officer | 50px | 1st master chief | 50px | Warrant officer | 50px |- | OR-7 | 1st sergeant-major | 50px | 1st sergeant-major | 50px | 1st master | 50px | 1st sergeant major | 50px |- ! colspan=9 | Junior non-commissioned officers - Lagere onderofficieren - Sous-officiers subalternes - Niedriger Unteroffiziere |- | OR-6 | 1st master sergeant | 50px | 1st master sergeant | 50px | Master chief | 50px | 1st master sergeant | 50px |- | OR-6 | 1st sergeant | 50px | 1st sergeant | 50px | Master | 50px | 1st sergeant | 50px |- | OR-5 | Sergeant | 50px | Sergeant | 50px | 2nd master | 50px | Sergeant | 50px |} ==Volunteers== {| class="wikitable" |- ! NATO code ! colspan=2 | Land component ! colspan=2 | Air component ! colspan=2 | Marine component ! colspan=2 | Medical component |- ! colspan=9 | Elite volunteers - Keurvrijwilligers - Volontaires d'élite - Elitefreiwillige |- | OR-4 | 1st master corporal | 50px | 1st master corporal | 50px | 1st chief quartermaster | 50px | 1st master corporal | 50px |- | OR-4 | Master corporal | 50px | Master corporal | 50px | Chief quartermaster | 50px | Master corporal | 50px |- ! colspan=9 | Junior volunteers - Lagere vrijwilligers - Volontaire subalternes - Niedriger Freiwillige |- | OR-3 | Corporal | 50px | Corporal | 50px | Quartermaster | 50px | Corporal | 50px |- | OR-2 | 1st private | 50px | 1st private | 50px | 1st seaman | 50px | 1st private | 50px |- | OR-1 |colspan=2| Private |colspan=2| Private | Seaman | 50px | Private | 50px |} The rank names relating to corporal and sergeant are replaced with "brigadier" and "maréchal des logis/wachtmeester" in application to personnel of units whose traditions are related to or descend from horse units. These include the cavalry, artillery, and logistics units. Similarly, in the cavalry units, the lowest rank is named "cavalier/ruiter", they are addressed the title "Monsieur/Mijnheer", a remnant of the aristocratic origins of horse mounted units; it was sought to remove these names in March 2013, retaining only the generic rank names. Corps Corporal (Caporal de corps/korpskorporaal) is an appointment at the Corps level for individuals with the rank of 1st master corporal, its insignia is that of the 1st master corporal with a crown at the top.
